entries.title: Qualcomm Posts 12% Drop in Sales
entries.description: The designer of mobile-phone chips gave a muted outlook as it posted a 12% drop in sales, reflecting softness in the global smartphone market.

entries.title: FTC Denies Meta's Bid to Disqualify Chair Khan From Antitrust Suit
entries.description: The agency’s Democratic commissioners said federal ethics rules don’t require Lina Khan’s disqualification from judging Meta’s proposed acquisition of a virtual-reality company.

entries.title: Tether Ownership and Company Weaknesses Revealed in Documents
entries.description: A group of four men has controlled 86% of Tether Holdings, a company that operates a stablecoin at the heart of crypto’s alternative financial universe.

entries.title: Twitter to Charge Developers for API Access in Latest Revenue Push
entries.description: Elon Musk’s social-media company didn’t say how much it would charge.

entries.title: Okta to Lay Off 5% of Staff After Pandemic Hiring Spree
entries.description: The business-software provider will book a $15 million charge as it cuts about 300 jobs.

entries.title: TikTok Transparency Campaign Echoes Huawei Effort
entries.description: The Chinese-owned app is opening testing centers and promising access to core technology, similar to largely unsuccessful tactics used by the telecom giant.

entries.title: Google Is Expected to Post Drop in Ad Revenue
entries.description: The Alphabet unit’s fourth quarter was marked by a slowdown in the digital ad market and broader macroeconomic pressures.

entries.title: Fanatics Hires Google Executive to Lead Push Into Live-Streamed Shopping
entries.description: The sports-merchandise company plans to focus on creators who sell trading cards.

entries.title: Amazon Poised to Post Slowest Sales Growth in Decades
entries.description: The company’s e-commerce services and cloud-computing business are feeling the sting from recession concerns.

entries.title: Apple Sales Are Expected to Show First Decline in Nearly Four Years
entries.description: The iPhone maker contended with manufacturing disruptions in China during the December quarter.

entries.title: TikTok Dealt Another Hit as Democratic Senator Joins Calls for Banning the App
entries.description: Colorado Sen. Michael Bennet is calling on Apple and Google to bar TikTok from their app stores.
